text: Václav Havel Airport Prague, formerly Prague Ruzyně International Airport , is an international airport in Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. The airport was founded in 1937. In 2012, it was renamed after the last president of Czechoslovakia and the first president of the Czech Republic Václav Havel. In 2023, it had 13,828,137 passengers. The airport is a hub for Czech Airlines and Smartwings as well as a base for Ryanair and Eurowings. == Notes == == Other websites == * Official website Category:1937 establishments in Europe Prague Category:Buildings and structures in Prague Category:Transport in the Czech Republic
title: Václav Havel Airport Prague
